safety_edibility_notes: Protected in most jurisdictions. Traditional subsistence hunting by Arctic indigenous peoples is permitted. Muktuk (skin and blubber) is a traditional food. High mercury levels in some populations make consumption risky.
safety_warning_text: Belugas are generally docile and curious toward humans. No known fatal attacks on humans. Main risks are from entering cold Arctic waters.
safety_summary: Belugas are not aggressive toward humans and are known for their curiosity and playfulness. Exercise caution in cold Arctic waters. Respect their space for their protection, not yours.
safety_contraindications: Do not enter frigid Arctic waters
Do not feed or touch wild belugas
encounter_protocol: Observe from vessels. Allow belugas to approach if curious. Do not chase or pursue. Reduce speed when belugas are nearby.
